pronunciation: BDEL'LIUM, [ Bochard and Parkhurst translate it, pearl. Genesis 2:12. But it is doubtful whether the bdellium of the scriptures is that now used.]A

definitions.text: gummy resinous juice, produced by tree in East Indies, which we have satisfactory account. It brought from E. Indies from Arabia, in pieces different sizes figures, externally dark reddish brown, internally, clear not unlike to glue. To taste, slightly bitterish pungent; its odor agreeable. In mouth, becomes soft sticks to teeth; on red hot iron, readily catches flame burns with crackling noise. It as perfume medicine, being weak deobstruent.
